楊俊.definition: Yang Jun (571-600), son of the first Sui emperor 楊堅|杨坚[Yang2 Jian1]

楊億.definition: Yang Yi (974-1020), Northern Song dynasty writer and poet

楊凝式.definition: Yang Ningshi (873-954) calligrapher of the Five Dynasties period

楊利偉.definition: Yang Liwei (1965-), the first Chinese astronaut sent into space

楊堅.definition: first Sui emperor Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604

楊妃.definition: see 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1]

楊守仁.definition: Yang Shouren (1912-2005), PRC agricultural scientist; Yang Shouren (16th century), Ming dynasty scholar

楊家將.definition: Yang Saga, a popular fiction from the Northern Song, depicting the heroic Yang family 楊業|杨业 of warriors

楊寶森.definition: Yang Baosen (1909-1958), Beijing opera star, one of the Four great beards 四大鬚生|四大须生

楊尚昆.definition: Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader

楊建利.definition: Yang JianLi, PRC human rights activist

楊振寧.definition: Chen-Ning Franklin Yang (1922-), theoretical physicist, co-developer of Yang-Mills gauge theory, 1957 Nobel laureate

楊月清.definition: Yang Yueqing, Chinese-Canadian woman documentary film director

楊朱.definition: Yang Zhu (c. 440-360 BC), Chinese philosopher advocating ethical egoism

楊柳.definition: willow tree; poplar and willow; name of traditional tune

楊梅.definition: red bayberry (Myrica rubra), aka Chinese bayberry

楊森.definition: Yang Sen (1884-1977), Sichuan warlord and general

楊業.definition: Yang Ye (died 986), Chinese military general of the Northern Han and the Northern Song dynasties, defended the Song against invasion by the Liao 遼|辽[Liao2]

楊樹.definition: poplar tree; various trees of genus Populus

楊深秀.definition: Yang Shenxiu (1849-1898), one of the Six Gentlemen Martyrs 戊戌六君子[Wu4 xu1 Liu4 jun1 zi5] of the unsuccessful reform movement of 1898

楊潔篪.definition: Yang Jiechi (1950-), Chinese politician and diplomat, foreign minister of PRC 2007-2013

楊瀾.definition: Yang Lan (1968-), Chinese media proprietor, journalist, and talk show hostess

楊炯.definition: Yang Jiong (650-693?), one of the Four Great Poets of the Early Tang 初唐四傑|初唐四杰[Chu1 Tang2 Si4 jie2]

楊玉環.definition: Yang Yuhuan, aka Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1] (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1]

楊秀清.definition: Yang Xiuqing (1821-1856), organizer and commander-in-chief of the Taiping Rebellion

楊維.definition: Yang Wei (1979-), PRC badminton player, women's doubles specialist

楊致遠.definition: Jerry Yang (1968-), Taiwan-US millionaire and creator of Yahoo

楊虎城.definition: Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general

楊貴妃.definition: Yang Guifei (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1]

楊過.definition: Yang Guo, protagonist of "The Return of the Condor Heroes" 神鵰俠侶|神雕侠侣[Shen2diao1 Xia2lu:3]; (used jocularly as a verb "to have tested positive", since 楊|杨[Yang2] and 陽|阳[yang2] are homonyms)

楊采妮.definition: Charlie Young (1974-), Hong Kong actress and singer

楊銳.definition: Yang Rui (1855-1898), one of the Six Gentlemen Martyrs 戊戌六君子 of the unsuccessful reform movement of 1898; Yang Rui (1963-), host of "Dialogue" on CCTV News

楊開慧.definition: Yang Kaihui (1901-1930), Mao Zedong's second wife

楊陵.definition: Yangling District in Xianyang City 咸陽市|咸阳市[Xian2 yang2 Shi4], Shaanxi

楊陵區.definition: Yangling District in Xianyang City 咸陽市|咸阳市[Xian2 yang2 Shi4], Shaanxi
